definition: share (in a listed company)
variant of 個|个[ge4]
individual/this/that/size/classifier for people or objects in general

thigh/part of a whole/portion of a sum/(stock) share/strand of a thread/low-level administrative unit, translated as "section" or "department" etc, ranked below 科[ke1]/classifier for long winding things like ropes, rivers etc/classifier for smoke, smells etc: thread, puff, whiff/classifier for bands of people, gangs etc/classifier for sudden forceful actions

sentences.english: Mining and oil stocks moved lower, especially in London.
sentences.chinese: 伦敦股市方面，矿业和石油个股开盘走低。

sentences.english: My brother had a gas station, a car and a tractor.
sentences.chinese: 我的个股有一个加油站，一辆汽车和一辆拖拉机。

sentences.english: Index narrow shocks , stocks will remain active for some time.
sentences.chinese: 指数窄幅震荡，个股活跃仍将持续一段时间。

sentences.english: Three, the firm does not buy ex - dividend stocks.
If eliminated the de-listed individual shares, there would be totally about 40% individual shares increased accumulatively this week.
sentences.chinese: 剔除本周停牌的个股，两市四成个股一周累计上涨。

sentences.english: If eliminated the de-listed individual shares, there would be totally about 40% individual shares increased accumulatively this week.
sentences.chinese: 剔除本周停牌的个股，两市四成个股一周累计上涨。

sentences.english: The individual shares may be cheap, but the trend in the market is still down.
sentences.chinese: 个股而论是够便宜了，但大市还在下行。

sentences.english: KD is more accurate in index trend than individual share.
sentences.chinese: KD指标对指数大势较准确，对个股较差。

sentences.english: So turn instead to the good old-fashioned exercise of calculating target prices.
sentences.chinese: 那么还是重拾旧艺，好好计算计算个股的目标价位吧。

sentences.english: Almost all the stocks go out of the position at high points, no fear of being vacant.
sentences.chinese: 几乎所有的个股都出仓在高点，也不怕“踏空”。
